column6: Entities included in the organization's sustainability reporting
column7: SGH's report included Beach Energy Limited, Flyash Australia Pty Ltd, and Seven West Media Limited.

column6: Reporting period, frequency, and contact point

column7: SGH restated Coates' 2022 water withdrawal amount.
Deloitte and Bureau Veritas provided external assurance for SGH's report.

column6: Activities, value chain and other business relationships
column7: Seven Group Holdings Limited (SGH) is a diversified operating Group with market-leading Industrial Services, Energy, and Media businesses. Its operating approach combines disciplined execution and a strict focus on capital allocation to support its exceptional businesses and people.
SGH's WesTrac and Coates employ over 6,300 people.
SGH's Board of Directors comprises nine directors.

column6: Nomination and selection of the highest governance body
column13: The policy and procedure for selecting and appointing new Directors are attached to the Board Charter. Appointed Directors receive a formal letter of appointment setting out the terms of their appointment. The date each Director was appointed to the Board is announced to the ASX.
column20: Letter of appointment, new Director, Board Charter

column6: Chair of the highest governance body
column7: Mr Terry Davis is the chair of SGH's Board.

column6: Role of the highest governance body in overseeing the management of impacts
column13: As part of the induction process, Board appointees attend a briefing with the Chairman, meet with the Company Secretary about the Company's corporate governance framework, visit key business sites and meet with senior executives. In addition to the induction process for new Director appointments, from time to time, Directors attend external education seminars and peer group meetings regarding regulatory and compliance developments.
column20: Induction process, corporate governance framework, senior executive

column6: Delegation of responsibility for managing impacts
column7: The Management is charged with promulgating the Company's values across the organisation and is responsible for implementing the policies, business model and strategic objectives approved by the Board.

column6: Role of the highest governance body in sustainability reporting
Collective knowledge of the highest governance body
column13: The Board has developed a Board Skills Matrix, which is reviewed and updated annually to reflect the skills and experience required to deliver the Company's strategic objective. The Board believes that its current composition represents these skills and experiences well. It provides a mix of Directors with specialised knowledge relating to particular industries in which the Group businesses operate and general corporate, executive, and Director experience appropriate for the Company.

column6: Evaluation of the performance of the highest governance body
column13: During the financial year, Directors completed a Board Evaluation questionnaire concerning the Board, Committee and Director, including the Chairman's performance, from which aggregated data and responses were provided to the Chairman. Then, they presented it to the Board for discussion and feedback. The Board Evaluation questionnaire allows the Board to benchmark results yearly, identify Board performance priorities and governance framework enhancements, and improve the effectiveness of meetings and company processes.
column20: Board Evaluation questionnaire, performance priority, governance framework enhancement

column7: The Group's executive remuneration structure is designed to attract and retain high-performing individuals, align executive rewards with the Group's business objectives, and create long-term shareholder value.

The Group's reward structure comprises a significant component of KMP Executive remuneration tied to financial performance outcomes. Under the STI plan, award outcomes are adjusted for Group and Business Unit performance outcomes and differentiated for individual performance using a balanced scorecard approach.

The results delivered would not have been possible without their dedication and hard work. The Group's people, privileged assets, and performance culture are a strong foundation for continued growth in FY24 and beyond. On behalf of the management team, I thank you, our shareholders, for your continued support and commitment to your Company."

column13: The Board has established a risk management framework to actively identify, monitor, and manage risks across the Group. The Audit & Risk Committee administers the framework, which assists the Board in identifying and managing financial and non-financial risks.
column20: Risk Management Framework, financial risk, non-financial risk

column13: The Audit & Risk Committee maintains a Strategic Risk Assessment register, established in collaboration with subject matter experts throughout the Group's businesses who identify and assess the risk factors. The Committee ranks each risk's potential impact and likelihood accordingly.
column20: Strategic Risk Assessment register, subject matter expert, risk factor

column13: The Company's Share Trading policy prohibits employees, Directors, and KMP from dealing in the Company's shares if the dealing is not permitted under the Corporations Act. Therefore, following this policy, all KMP are prohibited from entering into arrangements that limit the executives' economic risk in connection with Seven Group Holdings securities that are unvested or remain subject to a holding lock.
column20: Share Trading Policy, Corporations Act, KMP

column6: Mechanisms for seeking advice and raising concern

column7: SGH's people have the right to freedom of association and collective bargaining, and it maintains constructive relationships with multiple unions that participate in the sectors where it operates.

column13: WesTrac has successfully enabled its customers to deploy remotely operated semiÃ¢ÂÂautonomous drilling to improve the utilisation and productivity of the drills and create a safer operating environment for their operators. WesTrac is helping several customers step to the next level of drilling technology innovation with autonomous drilling, which promises to deliver further increases in productivity, removal of operator variance, and improvement in hole placement accuracy.
column20: Semi-autonomous drilling, a safer operating environment, hole placement accuracy

column13: WesTrac took a big automation step in its Tomago Parts Distribution Centre in FY23 by commissioning the AutoStore automated warehousing system. The system provides an additional 1,000 square metres of space within the current storage footprint. It increases the number of product lines WesTrac carries, meaning customers will have faster access to more parts.
column20: AutoStore, Tomago Parts Distribution Centre, automated warehousing system

column13: In FY23, Coates introduced its IOTÃ¢ÂÂenabled Smart Site technology, which uses lowÃ¢ÂÂpower wide area networks (LPWAN) to capture data on the movement of equipment within a geofenced area and identify opportunities to improve tool time and work time productivity.
column20: Smart Site technology, LPWAN, tool time, work time

column6: Direct economic value generated and distributed
column7: SGH generated $9.6 billion in revenues in 2023.
